name: Napili Sunset

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this place. My husband and I spent 10 days on Maui, we left our last 4 nights to chance with booking so we could explore and find the best deal. We weren't too impressed with anything in Wailea and Kihea so we headed north. Napili Bay is a tucked away little gem. We check out a couple places and were sold on the Napili Sunset. Very friendly staff showed us a couple different places before we fell in love with a second floor corner suite. Very clean with the most spectacular view. It has a slightly dated decore but the lanai and view more than made up for it. We spent our last few days in Maui doing some of the best snorkeling ever- turtles and colourful reefs. Walking distance to the amazing Merrimans restaurant for one of the best happy hours and dinners ever.
reviews.title: Million Dollar view- affordable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at Napili Sunset on Maui... we have never enjoyed a vacation spot more than Napili Bay. We had booked a studio at Napili Sunset, upon arrival we were offered an upgrade to a beachfront 1 bedroom for a small increase in price. All we can say is... wow..the furnishing are very Hawaiian and very nice, but the view off the lanai is spectacular, well worth the usual extra cost. We spent a lot of our vacation just sitting and enjoying the view of the ocean, beach and the turtles , who cruise the ocean along the beach to see what the people are doing!!
reviews.title: Best place to stay on Maui

reviews.text: The staff is wonderful, front desk, housekeeping , grounds keeper, they are all so friendly.
reviews.title: You can't get any closer to the beach

reviews.text: Although Napili Sunset is an older property, it is immaculate..everyone strives to make sure you enjoy your vacation, which we did, we will never stay anywhere else on Maui, it was just wonderful. We will go back in the spring, can hardly wait.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Napili Sunset with my family for a week, and it was great. We really enjoyed having our own kitchen, and exploring the grocery store for new things to cook and eat. I realize that might not be everyone's idea of a vacation, but it is for us. The Napili Sunset is definately not a brand new, state of the art building, but that being said, it had lots of island charm. Decor is a decade or two outdated, but it had new appliances in the kitchen, and while we were there they were replacing carpet in another unit. All units seem to be well maintained.
reviews.title: Superb holiday

likes.liked: — views, spacious rooms and ez access

reviews.title: best spot on the beach for the price
reviews.text: Looking at Napili Sunset's website, I was a little bit worried that the accommodations were going to be "rough." Having now been to Napili Sunset, I can truly say that there's nothing to worry about. The rooms are decorated in fairly tacky Hawaiian beach theme and they're all teal and pink, but the place is spotless and every day I was amazed at what a good job the cleaning staff did. Napili Sunset's rooms are nothing to write home about, but they're well laid out and they're spotless. Who cares what your room looks like when you're in Hawaii -- most of the time you'll want to be outside on the beach anyhow! Also, you can't beat the location! Napili Sunset is right smack in the middle of Napili beach -- one of the most beautiful beaches on Maui. The beach-front rooms are, quite literally, right on the beach and are fantastic. If you want to take advantage of the cheaper poolside rooms, though, you're also getting a bargain. Napili Sunset allows their guests who are staying in the poolside rooms (right across the road) to use the private lounge chairs that are in front of the beach-front units, so you've always got access to the private lawn that's right on the beach. Of course, sitting on the beach itself is also great, but it's kind of a treat to be able to lie on your own lounge chair a few steps away from the sand without having to compete for it with everyone else on the beach. Napili Sunset really is SO close to the beach! We stayed poolside and I don't regret it one bit -- it was lovely, quiet, and only $115 a night! Napili Sunset isn't for anyone who is too uptight about needing luxury accommodation, but if it's a relaxed, clean hotel with easy beach access that you want, this is the place to go.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I made my reservation to stay at Napili Sunset last fall, based on the recommendation of my travel agent. When I was planning my trip in January and February, I became concerned because of one review in particular.
reviews.title: UnFounded Fears

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised because my accommodations were simply wonderful. I loved falling asleep to the sound of the surf. I loved drinking my cup of Kona coffee on the lanai watching the humpback whales swim and frolic just outside of the bay. I loved snorkeling in the bay, watching all of the beautiful coral, fish and turtles. I loved drinking my glass of wine as I watched the sun set over the sea between Molokai and Lanai.
reviews.title: Once our favorite, will never go back

reviews.text: I lead a stressful life. This was the relaxing vacation I needed. I can’t say it was a second honeymoon, because it was more like our tenth. I will be back to Napili Sunset; next time with my children and their families.
reviews.title: Great Location on Great Beach

reviews.text: I’m just frustrated because they are sold out for the weeks I was available in July and August. Because they only confirm reservations 365 days in advance, I am “wait listed” for four rooms for August 2009. But I was reassured that I would not have a problem getting a confirmed reservation. Maybe I’ll go back this fall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in studio room # 104 on June 11-13, 2007. Great place, the murphy bed was very comfortable. Room was very clean and the kitchen was well stocked. I believe the loveseat also folds out to a bed if you had two younger children. The unit had a/c. The unit walked out to the pool and was a 30 second walk to a nice beach. The staff were very friendly. We found it to be very quiet.
reviews.title: Studios A Good Value

likes.disliked: — Locals hanging out at shoreline access trail.

reviews.text: On June 15, 2007 we stayed here again but had studio # 201. This room was a little bigger and had a normal bed instead of the fold down murphy bed. Again this unit was clean and had lots of kitchen supplies. The owners of this unit also had plenty of videos and music tapes you could listen too in the unit.
reviews.title: Great view

likes.liked: — ocean front and 2 bedrooms for the price of 1
likes.disliked: — traffic on street behind the building

reviews.text: Both units had a fridge, stove, microwave, and a dishwasher. The complex has a laundry room and provides free detergent and fabric sheets.
reviews.title: Nice views-Terrible bed !!!

reviews.text: We stayed for four hours at this hotel and were enchanted by it nonetheless. We spent a week in a Kapalua Bay Villa and on the last day we need to put the kids up for half a day so that they can get their afternoon nap. They offered this little studio to us for $90 for half a day. It was small but had everything one might need - a clean kitchen area, a colorfully decorated bathroom, a cute little patio looking down to the small pool. The bed is hidden in a closet to save space so you pull it down. This place feels more like an owner-occupied home than a rental property because of all the personal touches in the room.
reviews.title: An enchanting place
Love Maui- Disliked the loony/drunk locals
reviews.text: The best part is we can walk to the beach in about 1 and half minute even though these smaller units are not right on the beach! Napili beach is beautiful and fun - great for people watching but not too crowded.

reviews.title: Loved it!!!
reviews.text: There were no ACs in the room so I can imagine it getting a little too hot in summer here. Towards the end of the four hours we realized that we all got mosquito bites on our exposed arms and legs so we ran out of there. Howeever we will always remember this place fondly as it is so "cute" and cozzy!

description: NAMED ONE OF THE TOP 10 BEACH FRONT HOTELS IN THE WORLD BY FROMMERS, Napili Sunset is different from most hotels; Napili Sunset is quite literally, on the beach. Napili Sunset’s two story Kanani and Kekalani buildings house 26 units which open to an elevated lawn with a commanding view of Napil Bay, the islands of Molokai and Lanai, and spectacular sunsets over the Pacific Ocean. Napili Sunset is on Napili Bay, a quarter mile long and crescent shaped, the bay forms a beach with warm golden sand and inviting blue waters. Reefs protect the beach from large waves and provide a home for colorful tropical fish, sea turtles and beautiful coral. Napili beach is widely recognized as one of the best beaches in all of Hawaii.
